definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Premier Zhou's illustrious deeds are an everlasting monument in the hearts of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 周总理的光辉业绩在中国人民心中立下了不朽的丰碑。

sentences.english: Certainly, Narcissa, I shall make the Unbreakable Vow, " he said quietly."
sentences.chinese: 当然，纳西莎，我会立下牢不可破誓言。

sentences.english: Years before, Van Buren had done much himself to elect Jackson to the White House.
sentences.chinese: 几年前，范布伦为杰克逊入主白宫立下了汗马功劳。

sentences.english: Einstein has performed immortal feats for bringing forward the time of terminating the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦为二战的结束时间提前，立下了不朽的功勋。

sentences.english: So, I want you to be successful. So, I put this up.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你们成功，所以我立下这点。

sentences.english: So now , crowned goddess, I make this vow.
sentences.chinese: 所以现在，戴着桂冠的女神，我在此立下誓言。

sentences.english: For the Guggenheim Mr. Gehry was enlisted to replicate his success in Bilbao, Spain.
sentences.chinese: 盖瑞被请来重现他在西班牙毕尔包古根汉立下的伟业。

sentences.english: This trendy pewter pendant makes a strong statement about your personal commitment to purity.
sentences.chinese: 这款时尚白镴坠炼为您守贞的承诺立下有力的声明。

sentences.english: But he confesses to being wary of having “too many aims and goals”.
sentences.chinese: 然而他坦言要谨慎，以免立下“过多的目标”。

sentences.english: Jujube for us set the "send warm Gong."
sentences.chinese: 枣树为我们立下了“送暖功”。

sentences.english: The vows of love which we have made will live until we die.
sentences.chinese: 我们立下的爱的誓言将会至死不变。

sentences.english: Approximately 25% of the participants responded that they had made a pledge to abstain from sex until marriage.
sentences.chinese: 大约25%的参与者说到他们已经立下了童贞誓约。

sentences.english: Bazookas have a long range and are very destructive, they make a strong contribution in wars.
sentences.chinese: 火箭炮的射程远，杀伤力强，在战争中立下汗马功劳。

sentences.english: We foolishly believe that our own limitations are the proper measure of limitations.
sentences.chinese: 我们以为自己立下的规矩，就是最妥切的尺度。
那位修女立下严格的誓愿。

sentences.english: Along the way, the demons, made a great contribution.
sentences.chinese: 一路上，悟空降妖除魔，立下了大功劳。

definition: achievement/meritorious deed/contributions (for the good of society)
war on all sides (idiom); fighting from all four quarters
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
minister who has given outstanding service
to render meritorious service/to make worthy contributions/to distinguish oneself
to lay (a foundation)/to conquer (a city etc)/to shoot down (a bird etc)
